I aged out a bit ago. I had to jimmie the sizes a bit to make it smaller and match the other picture.

My crew number was 629 Cornnuts 3. Got it branded on the inside of my Philmont belt by a nice brander, too.

[@Dman979](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/123837-dman979/)thats cool.  My crew's name started out as the salty dogs in reference to the sweat we would make at philmont and while we were there it turned into the soggy salty dogs because of  the wet weather and us being really sweaty 

-JWOC

My crew's name started out as the salty dogs in reference to the sweat we would make at philmont and while we were there it turned into the soggy salty dogs because of  the wet weather and us being really sweaty

Were you northcountry or southcountry?

We had our fair share of rain, too. A few days before we arrived a scout was killed by a flash flood, and we hiked by in our trek. When we were hiking from Peublano to Dan Beard (DB had the *best* water) we got diverted about 2 and a half miles by a flooded river. We ended up hiking about 3 miles out of our way in the rain. For the last mile, we were going across a butte in the rain and lightning. 3 of our scouts got mild cases of hypothermia. Not a fun day.

> 
> 
> Just now, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> Were you northcountry or southcountry?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> We had our fair share of rain, too. A few days before we arrived a scout was killed by a flash flood, and we hiked by in our trek. When we were hiking from Peublano to Dan Beard (DB had the *best* water) we got diverted about 2 and a half miles by a flooded river. We ended up hiking about 3 miles out of our way in the rain. For the last mile, we were going across a butte in the rain and lightning. 3 of our scouts got mild cases of hypothermia. Not a fun day.
> 

southcountry  we went out of basecamp the rayado turnaround and went up the tooth. our second to last day on trail was eventful. we had a horse ride that day and as we came back it started to be cloudy like every other day we had during our trip and then it started raining and then started hailing and we also had some lighting. that day it rained 3 inches within 30 minutes we ended up being the epicenter of the entire stor. and we still had to hike after that and all of our bags got soaked. that night we ended up in some trail camp that nobody else was in and almost flell into a lake as our camp site was near lake.  my dad tried to light a fire with white gas beacuse he was so cold and wet. it didn't work.  to sum it all up my trek was pretty darn good. 

-JWOC

> 
>
